items.abstract: <jats:p>The method was developed for the synthesis of biologically important adenosine phosphates, AMP, cAMP and ATP modified with <jats:italic>p</jats:italic>-carborane cluster - a highly lipophilic pharmacophore. The adenosine phosphates modified with <jats:italic>p</jats:italic>-carborane are characterized by increased stability in human blood plasma and much more higher lipophilicity than that of the unmodified phosphates. ATP analog <jats:bold>4</jats:bold> bearing <jats:italic>p</jats:italic>-carborane cluster is not a Taq polymerase substrate and most probably not the polymerase inhibitor. These properties may have clinical implications. </jats:p>
title: Highly Lipophilic p-Carborane-Modified Adenosine Phosphates
